result.markdown:
::: {.question} **Post-money valuation and VC ownership** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(505) #| eval: true #| results: asis #| echo: false #| warning: false library(webexercises) v1 <- round(runif(1, 0.2, 0.3), 3) v2 <- round(runif(1, 1, 2), 3) v3 <- round(runif(1, 1, 2), 3) v4 <- round(runif(1, 5, 6), 3) v5 <- round(runif(1, 2, 3), 3) # Cálculos total_shares <- v2 + v3 + v5 price_per_share <- v4 / v5 post_money <- round(total_shares * price_per_share, 3) vc_pct <- round(v5 / total_shares * 100, 3) ``` ::: You founded a firm three years ago. You started with $0.213 million, which gave you 1.504 million shares. You later sold 1.1 million shares to angel investors. Now, a VC firm wants to invest $5.091 million in exchange for 2.021 million new shares. ::: {.question-block}
1. What is the post-money valuation (in million)?
✅ Post-money = Total shares × Price per share = (4.62) × (2.52) = **11.651 million**
::: ::: {.question-block}
2. What percentage of the firm will the VC own?
✅ VC Ownership = 2.021 / (4.625) × 100 = **43.697%**
::: :::
